<p>
Winchester<br/>
8.40 p.m. March 4<a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?year=1862">/62</a>
</p><p>
General
</p><p>
My dispatch to Genl. Johnston of yesterday as well as today was important. Please let me now at once whether either of them was captured. I think that we had better send nothing more for the present via Snicker's Gap, but everything via Ashby's. I will keep a lookout for [Miss] Osborn. I will understand the [ ]1. The Yankees are in Smithfield which is about 6 miles west of Charles Town.
Respectfully your Obdt. Servt.
<a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?tla=tjj" rel="me">T. J. Jackson</a>
Maj. Genl.
</p><p>
Brig Genl. D. H. Hill<br/>
Comd C. S. Forces, Leesburg.
</p>
